bust up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if people bust up, they end their relationship or friendship
bust up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: They bust up after six years of marriage.
bust up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to prevent an illegal activity or bad situation from continuing
bust up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: A couple of teachers stepped in to bust up the fight.
bust up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: A bunch of bikers busted up the bar.
bust up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Elaine busted up laughing at the sight of him.
bust up.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a very bad quarrel or fight
bust up.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Cathy and I had a real bust-up yesterday.
bust up.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to break a unit such as a company or department into parts, or to end it completely
bust up.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The auto maker may have to bust up the finance unit or sharply limit the credit it extends to buyers and dealers.
bust up.translation[3].definitions[0].de: when a unit such as a company or department is broken into parts
bust up.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: a boardroom bust-up, when the chief executive walked out after six weeks in the job
